Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that the list of courses is from Harvard University.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the list is not from Harvard University but from a student newspaper.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the list is accurate and represents the difficulty of courses at Harvard University without verifying its authenticity.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the significance of the list by presenting it as a ranking of the "most difficult courses" at Harvard University.
Understate: It is unclear if the claim understates any information or biases.
